intro: Mapania geelvinkensis, commonly known as the Geelvink's mapania, is a rare flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Papua. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elongated leaves and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
